This reaction is triggered by an abnormal release of calcium from the sarcoplasmic reticulum in skeletal muscle cells, which leads to sustained muscle contraction and increased metabolic demand. In cases of malignant hyperthermia, the abnormal release of calcium can disrupt glycine receptor function and contribute to skeletal muscle rigidity and increased reflexes.
